headline: Spies Will Doom Putin
author: Douglas London
sentences: I spent 34 years in the Central Intelligence Agency’s clandestine service, and watching Vladimir Putin’s brutal war in Ukraine from the sidelines fills me with both sadness and a sense of opportunity.
Mr. Putin’s disastrous choices are causing military strategists to reconsider which tactics could be used against Russia’s overrated and underperforming armed forces.
Mr. Putin’s self-inflicted damage has done more to turn his own people against him than anything the West could have done.
Political experts and economists are rethinking tools for punishing malign behavior.

If your job is cultivating spies, I suspect that recruiting must be good.
Espionage is a predatory business, and there’s blood in the water.
Other potential aggressors—namely China—must take notice.
